start.speaker: Rusk
start.text:
They want payment in blood and call it necessity.

No. If we pay, we pay in heat, sweat, and time. Not someone else’s suffering.

choices.text: Take the bargain—then make them regret it.

end.speaker: Narrator
end.text: Rusk’s eyes narrow. His anger isn’t wild—it’s precise, the way a chisel is precise.
